skill.name: when-managing-github-projects-use-github-project-management
skill.description: Comprehensive GitHub project management with swarm-coordinated issue tracking, project board automation, and sprint planning. Coordinates planner, issue-tracker, and project-board-sync agents to automate issue triage, sprint planning, milestone tracking, and project board updates. Integrates with GitHub Projects v2 API for advanced automation, custom fields, and workflow orchestration. Use when managing development projects, coordinating team workflows, or automating project management tasks.
skill.summary: Comprehensive GitHub project management with swarm-coordinated issue tracking, project board automat...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code. All content is workflow documentation describing how to use external scripts and MCP tools. No actual scripts, network calls, or file operations are included within the skill itself.

content.value_statement: Managing GitHub projects manually wastes time and creates inconsistent tracking. This skill coordinates intelligent agents to automate issue triage, sprint planning, milestone tracking, and board synchronization using GitHub Projects v2 API.
actual_capabilities: Automated issue triage with intelligent classification and routing
Sprint planning with capacity estimation and backlog composition
Project board synchronization using GitHub Projects v2 API
Swarm-coordinated agent orchestration for multi-agent workflows
Custom field automation and workflow configuration
limitations: Requires external scripts (github-api.sh, project-api.sh) to be created separately
Depends on claude-flow MCP server for agent coordination features
Does not include built-in GitHub API authentication; users must configure their own credentials
Cannot access private repositories without proper GitHub token configuration

use_cases.title: Coordinate team sprints
use_cases.description: Plan and track development sprints with automated capacity planning, backlog composition, and daily status updates.

use_cases.title: Automate issue workflows
use_cases.description: Set up automated issue classification, labeling, assignment, and project board updates based on issue content.

use_cases.title: Track release milestones
use_cases.description: Monitor milestone progress, identify delivery risks, generate stakeholder reports, and coordinate release activities.

prompt_templates.title: Start sprint planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the GitHub project management skill to plan Sprint 42. Calculate team capacity, review the backlog, create the sprint milestone, and set up the sprint board with 6 team members.

prompt_templates.title: Triage new issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the automated issue triage workflow. Initialize a star swarm, monitor for new issues, classify issue #145 as bug/high severity, assign to frontend team, and update the project board.

prompt_templates.title: Track release progress
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a milestone progress report for v2.0.0 release. Identify any issues at risk of missing the deadline and create stakeholder update with risk mitigation recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Configure custom fields
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure GitHub Projects v2 custom fields for complexity scoring, priority calculation, and team assignment. Set up automated field updates based on issue classification.

output_examples.input: Run the automated issue triage workflow for a new bug report about login failure
output: Issue #247 classified as: type=bug, severity=high, component=authentication
Added to Sprint 41 board in Triage column
Linked to related issue #189 (similar login bug)
Milestone: v2.1.0 - targeted for next release

best_practices: Initialize the star topology swarm before starting any project management workflow for proper agent coordination.
Run daily board sync operations to keep project boards accurate and maintain team trust in the automation.
Store classification and assignment decisions in memory using the github/triage and github/assignments namespaces for audit trails.
anti_patterns: Skipping duplicate check before assigning issues leads to duplicated work and wasted team effort.
Overloading sprints beyond calculated capacity causes burnout and missed delivery commitments.
Failing to update board status after PR merges creates stale boards that no one trusts.

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires the claude-flow MCP server for agent coordination features.

faq.question: What GitHub API permissions are needed?
faq.answer: A GitHub personal access token with repo and project scopes is required for full functionality.

faq.question: Can this skill work with private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, with proper GitHub token configuration. The token must have access to the private repositories.

faq.question: Are my project data stored safely?
faq.answer: This skill only reads and writes to GitHub APIs. No data is stored externally or shared with third parties.

faq.question: Why are scripts referenced but not included?
faq.answer: The scripts (github-api.sh, project-api.sh) are external utilities. Users create them based on the skill documentation.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Actions automation?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-driven orchestration for project management. GitHub Actions handles CI/CD tasks. They complement each other.
